entity.name: Gladiators
entity.entry:
This is a guild I'm playing around with for martial classes and I haven't come up with the reasons why one would want to risk life and limb in the [location:6801073] dozens of time to gain titles. Perhaps these individual are slaves or Perigrini and elevating to Champion grants not only fame, but citizenship.  In which case it might be handled in a similar fashion to the [organisation:6801419] where it's a matter of leveling up (DnD-style) through the ranks.

  • Tiro: (Novice lvls 1-2) - Just beginning training. Learning the basics of combat, weapon handling, and gladiator etiquette.
  • Lanistae: (Lanistae's Trainee lvls 3-4) - Training under the watchful eye of a Lanista (gladiator trainer/owner). Focus on specific weapon styles and combat techniques. If you were a slave, you are now freed, "Peregrini" - see [organisation:6801105]
  • Bestiarius: (Beast Fighter 5-8) - Specializes in fighting monstrous beasts. Often considered lower status but requires courage and skill. If you were "Peregrini" you are now "Plebeian" - see [organisation:6801105]
  • Primus Palus: (First Sword level 9+) - The champion gladiator of a ludus (gladiatorial school). High status and fame. If you were "Plebeian" you are now "Patrician" - see [organisation:6801105]
  • Champion/Primus Gladiator (Requires in-game fight and lvl 10): A gladiator who has won numerous fights and achieved widespread fame.  If you were "Patrician" you are now "Equestrian" - see [organisation:6801105] 

How does that seem.... potential Martials?

[character:7360697] is the current Champion
